text:
‚ö° Replacing a light switch is easier than you think. But skip one step and it gets dangerous fast.

---

‚úÖ Good videos show: turn off the breaker, test with a voltage tester, match wires to the new switch. Solid basics.

---

‚ö†Ô∏è What they miss: ALWAYS test BOTH sides of the switch with a non-contact voltage tester. Mislabeled breaker panels are way more common than you'd think. Also ‚Äî backstab connections (push-in) loosen over time. Use the screw terminals.

---

üí° George's Pro Tip: Take a photo of the old wiring BEFORE you disconnect anything. Future you will thank present you. And wrap your connections with electrical tape over the wire nuts.

---

üì± Too big for DIY? George can book a pro in 60 seconds ‚Üí uptendapp.com

Save this for later ‚Äî your home will thank you. üè†
